entry.title: $100K grant from Sony to fund speech generation

link.title: $100K grant from Sony to fund speech generation

entry.content: Sony corporation has awarded us $100 as part of their Research Award Program to fund our research grant titled “Expressive and Controllable Voice Synthesis and Conversion”.
entry.summary: Sony corporation has awarded us $100 as part of their Research Award Program to fund our research grant titled “Expressive and Controllable Voice Synthesis and Conversion”.

entry.title: New NeurIPS paper
entry.content: Our paper VoiceBlock: Privacy through Real-Time Adversarial Attacks with Audio-to-Audio Models has been accepted for presentation at NeurIPS 2022
entry.summary: Our paper VoiceBlock: Privacy through Real-Time Adversarial Attacks with Audio-to-Audio Models has been accepted for presentation at NeurIPS 2022

entry.title: $1.8 million Future of Work award from NSF

link.title: $1.8 million Future of Work award from NSF

entry.content: TEAMuP, Our collaboration with the University of Rochester has been awarded a $1.8 million Future of Work at the Human-Technology Frontier award from NSF. For more details on what we’re doing see our project Deep Learning Tools for Audacity or see this story.
entry.summary: TEAMuP, Our collaboration with the University of Rochester has been awarded a $1.8 million Future of Work at the Human-Technology Frontier award from NSF. For more details on what we’re doing see our project Deep Learning Tools for Audacity or see this story.

entry.title: Erika Rumbold defends thesis
entry.content: Erika Rumbold defended the MS thesis “A Critical Analysis of Objective Evaluation Metrics for Music Source Separation Quality” and will be starting a doctoral program at the University of Victoria. She will be missed!
entry.summary: Erika Rumbold defended the MS thesis “A Critical Analysis of Objective Evaluation Metrics for Music Source Separation Quality” and will be starting a doctoral program at the University of Victoria. She will be missed!

entry.title: Music Separation Enhancement with Generative Modeling accepted to ISMIR 2022

link.title: Music Separation Enhancement with Generative Modeling accepted to ISMIR 2022

entry.content: Our paper “Music Separation Enhancement with Generative Modeling” was accepted to ISMIR 2022.
entry.summary: Our paper “Music Separation Enhancement with Generative Modeling” was accepted to ISMIR 2022.

entry.title: Ethan Manilow defends dissertation
entry.content: Ethan Manilow defended the thesis “Score-Informed and Hierarchical Methods for Computational Musical Scene Analysis” and will be taking a job at Google Brain. He will be missed!
entry.summary: Ethan Manilow defended the thesis “Score-Informed and Hierarchical Methods for Computational Musical Scene Analysis” and will be taking a job at Google Brain. He will be missed!

entry.title: Our tech inside Adobe’s new AI-powered audio editor

link.title: Our tech inside Adobe’s new AI-powered audio editor

entry.content:
Adobe just announced their Project Shasta web-based AI-powered audio editing and recording suite. This uses the work in our patent application “Sound quality prediction and interface to facilitate high-quality voice recordings” to ensure users make better recordings.

See the Voice Assist video or the our 2019 CHI paper “VoiceAssist: Guiding Users to High-Quality Voice Recordings”for the technical details.
entry.summary: Adobe just announced their Project Shasta web-based AI-powered audio editing and recording suite. This uses the work in our patent application “Sound quality prediction and interface to facilitate high-quality voice recordings” to ensure users make better recordings.

entry.title: Bose releases hearing aids using our tech

link.title: Bose releases hearing aids using our tech

entry.content: Bose has released their new SoundControl hearing aids, which use the work in our patent “Systems, methods, and apparatus for equalization preference learning”.
entry.summary: Bose has released their new SoundControl hearing aids, which use the work in our patent “Systems, methods, and apparatus for equalization preference learning”.

entry.title: Best Paper at ISMIR 2021
entry.content: Our publication “Leveraging Hierarchical Structures for Few-Shot Musical Instrument Recognition” has won best paper at ISMIR 2021. Congratulations to Hugo Flores Garcia, Aldo Aguilar and Ethan Manilow! Watch the video. Check out the source code.
entry.summary: Our publication “Leveraging Hierarchical Structures for Few-Shot Musical Instrument Recognition” has won best paper at ISMIR 2021. Congratulations to Hugo Flores Garcia, Aldo Aguilar and Ethan Manilow! Watch the video. Check out the source code.

entry.title: We host the Bay Innovative Signal Hackers Bash

link.title: We host the Bay Innovative Signal Hackers Bash

entry.content: Please join us for the October 27 virtual BISH Bash meetup, which Bryan Pardo will be hosting, as head of Northwestern University’s Interactive Audio Lab. We will have 4 talks from lab members, followed by Q&A, and some networking over Zoom video conferencing. We hope to see you all there! Click HERE to see the talk abstracts and sign up for this virtual event on Zoom.
entry.summary: Please join us for the October 27 virtual BISH Bash meetup, which Bryan Pardo will be hosting, as head of Northwestern University’s Interactive Audio Lab. We will have 4 talks from lab members, followed by Q&A, and some networking over Zoom video conferencing. We hope to see you all there! Click HERE to see the talk abstracts and sign up for this virtual event on Zoom.
